meanings.definition: The art or practice of composing or singing ballads.
meanings.sent1: Her balladry filled the room with beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent2: The concert featured a mix of traditional and modern balladry.
meanings.sent3: His balladry was so moving that even the birds stopped to listen.
meanings.sent4: The balladry of her voice painted a picture of love and loss.
meanings.sent5: The power of her balladry lingered in the air long after the song ended.

meanings.sent1: The library had a section dedicated to classic balladry.
meanings.sent2: The album was a compilation of the best balladry from the past decade.
meanings.sent3: Listening to the balladry of old tales made him feel nostalgic.
meanings.sent4: The balladry of the troubadours echoed through the medieval streets.
meanings.sent5: The haunting balladry of the singer captivated the audience.
